name: Mercure London Staines-upon-Thames Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night as I was going to a concert at Twickenham. I paid just £60 for a superior double which I think is great value.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for the price

reviews.text: The room was of a generous size, on the ground floor with patio doors out on to a garden area beside the Thames - beautiful.
reviews.title: Not as Bad as Previous Reviews

likes.disliked: — doesn't look too good from the front outside

reviews.text: The room had a very comfortably double bed, modern style bathroom with bath & shower over, Tea & coffee making facilities, TV, hair dryer and a minibar.
reviews.title: A nice enough hotel

reviews.text: There is a nice relaxed bar area, and a bright & airy restaurant but we did not eat at the hotel.
reviews.title: It's fine

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is good, but can be a little noisy due to trains crossing the adjacent bridge and planes coming in to Heathrow. The nearest train station is a 10-15 mins walk away with a direct link to London Waterloo so ideal if you want to visit Westminster, the London Eye, Buck House etc.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing

reviews.text: Stayed here for my partner's graduation from nearby university.
reviews.title: "The" hotel (literally) in Central Staines

reviews.text: The hotel is right on the Thames and right across the street from the Staines bus stop and a few minutes away from the train station (trains are about 20 minutes to London Waterloo). Staines' High Street is also a few blocks away so this is as central as you can get it you're staying in the Staines area.
reviews.title: Their last chance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a small single room, exactly what one would expect from a 3 star UK establishment. It was not airconditioned, but it had a small balcony that gave out to the Thames River and the room was breezy and cool at all times (even needed a blanket in the middle of the night). This is not a luxury establishment, but it was clean, good sized bathroom and somewhat "quaint". The breakfast area (great full English) was also right on the River and afforded some great views. Despite it being in the centre of town (although of course, it's Staines, not London), it was very peaceful given its River location and quiet. I would stay here again if I needed to stay in the Staines area.
reviews.title: Excellent price for such a large room, bonus free parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have used this hotel for some years now, we know Staines very well and its a handy place for accessing areas of London by train. In the beginning it was very good, but the last 3 times we have visited have been gradually worse. This time we arrived in a mini heat-wave to find the room allocated was tiny, very hot and frankly tired looking. We requested another room but the 2 we were offered were no ireal improvemnet. Still we accepted a new room on the ground floor and tried to switch on the AC, it didn't work, neither did the fridge. We asked for a fan which was delivered and did cool things down a little. Next morning my husband went straight off to a business meeting after having paid for the room and for breakfast for me. Breakfast is until 10pm on Friday's so I went into the dining room at 9.30am, I was ingored by the waiter who seemed to not have a clue about what he was supposed to be doing. I eventually got his attention and ordered white toast and strong black coffee, he brought me no toast and week tea!! When I mentioned that this wasn't what I'd ordered he looked confused and wandered off. I helped my self to cooked breakfast when the waiter came back with coffee but...no toast, which was when I found a foreign object in my breakfast!! It was a bit of black plastic with some kind of hair/string attached, obviously this put me off my meal, but I called the waiter over - who unsurprisingly just looked even more confused. The manager came at my request and apologised assuring me that the cost of my breadfast would be deducted from the bill, but that didn't really take the edge of what was a nasty experience. All in all the hotel is tired and grubby, the staff not really up to the job and you are left with the feeling that you are just a number - not very welcoming to be honest. Worst of all the best price they could give us was £130 for one night without breakfast, very high for not a very good experience. As I said above that was their last chance and we will in future stray at another hotel
reviews.title: Good friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had been driving for two hours looking for a reasonable priced hotel or b&b all around windsor, then kept driving up to Staines when we saw the Mecure. It was around 9.30pm and we were getting desperate, so were very surprised when we were told a double room was 70 pounds. We parked our car at the front of the hotel and we were surprised at the size of the room. The shower and toilet flashing weren't the best, but comfy bed made up for it. Nice location right on the Thames. Helpful staff.
reviews.title: Not Brilliant !

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel when visiting family in the area recently.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, would stay again

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel and the location is fantastic, they have a nice area outside at the back of the hotel to have drinks and a bite to eat while watching the boats go by on the thames. The rooms were nice, and as clean as can be, beds very comfey and has all the usual amenities.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: A few down sides to this hotel, firstly the showers... terriable the shower was just a trickle of water and had no power to it what so ever. We werent the only ones staying in this hotel with the same problem.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.text: We also had a issue with some drink prices, we were clearly over charged for a late night round, when questioned with the staff it turned out we'd been over charged by £5 and in return they gave us some crisps.... so check your bills. !
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Overall had a very nice stay, and had to say all the staff were very friendly and as helpful as could be.
reviews.title: Lovely river scenes

likes.liked: — Looking across the river and watching the rowers launch their boats whilst having breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel on the day of arrival (last minute) and was still offered £69.00 B&B, Brilliant value.
reviews.title: Great Location & Value (Ideal for LHR & Thorpe Park)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had one night & one day before flying out of LHR. Great location in Staines, 2 mins from the bus station and a train station. Went to Thorpe Park takes 5 mins on express bus 950 & only £3.00 return. Don't get ripped off with taxi's from Heathrow unless you have loads of luggage, bus 441 goes from main bus station and costs £2.00 single or bus 71 goes from terminal 5...
reviews.title: Small rooms

likes.liked: — Handy location for wedding in Eggham

reviews.text: Rooms modern & clean, not sure if we got a new room that had been modified. Breakfast was yummy, plenty to choose from and at table service (full english) served....
reviews.title: Lack of information by staff!

likes.disliked: — Attitude of bar staff in the evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff lovely no issues at all.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel for the Money

reviews.text: Only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars was because, ground floor rooms are unsecure, the windows open fully onto the car park and the main road, and the window locks where broken so I was a little paranoid of been broken into, which I wasn't thank god but Staines is a lovely area so no need really to worry, would suggest asking for high floor.
reviews.title: Excellent choice near Heathrow.

description: Set on the River Thames, this town centre hotel offers 79 en suite bedrooms. Only 3 miles to Thorpe Park and 12 miles to Heathrow with easy connections to Central London, Twickenham and Windsor. The restaurant & terrace bar offer a panoramic view of the river. . Easy access via the M25, with free parking (30 spaces) & free mooring. Free use of our local leisure centre (Gym, indoor pool & Jacuzzi)
